title: The tower of Hercules, Spain
content: The oldest lighthouse in the world, the Tower of Hercules, also known as the Lighthouse of Corunna, or Farum Brigantium was built some time in the century II. Is located in the northwest of Spain, in the vicinity of the city of Corunna. It is believed that the tower built by the romans has been based on the Lighthouse of Alexandria. While the building of 55 meters is about 1900 years, the structure is not entirely unique - for a reform of 1791, the three-story tower has received a floor additional.
